title: Listen to the scenario and then answer questions

What is the purpose of your meeting?

choices: No, but I'm a quick learner and I'm willing to do whatever it takes to help out

questions.audioText: Then this will be a good research opportunity for you. The first thing you can do is look through some of the existing literature on the Ottoman Empire and see what other scholars have said about it. Then we can start brainstorming ideas for the project.
choices: Okay, that sounds like a good place to start. How long do you think the project will take?

questions.audioText: If we get started soon, I think it would be feasible to finish within a few months. The grant proposal is due at the end of the year.
choices: Okay, that sounds like something I can do. Do you have any specific schools in mind that you want me to compare our department to?

Okay, I'll work on making some changes to the budget and then

questions.audioText: Perfect! Let's aim to have most of the research done by summer so that we can focus on writing the proposal in the fall semester. Does that sound like a plan?
choices: Yeah, that sounds good to me!
Okay, that sounds fair. My apologies!
Yeah, that's definitely a plus!

questions.SummaryExample: I met with the professor to discuss my duties as a research assistant for their project. I will be helping them write a grant proposal for a research study on the Ottoman Empire, especially with surveying the existing literature. We worked out the schedule so that I would get most of the research done during the summer as a full-time and we could focus on the actual writing part during the fall semester.
